name: metathesis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of changing the positions of consonants (= speech sounds or letters of the alphabet that are not vowels) in words, or an example of this: Metathesis typically occurs when a relatively rare sound combination can be swapped for a much more familiar one. Each of these metatheses caused a chuckle of delight.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen lecturing, he was prone to metathesis."Tilde" is thought to be a metathesis in Spanish of "tidlo".I would expect this particular metathesis to fall out of vogue now that the computer era has made "disk" a household word.
